## Create a data table, use reactable()

* install.packages("reactable") 
* library(reactable)


### Dataset mtcars

A data frame with 32 observations on 11 (numeric) variables.

* [, 1]	mpg	Miles/(US) gallon
* [, 2]	cyl	Number of cylinders
* [, 3]	disp	Displacement (cu.in.)
* [, 4]	hp	Gross horsepower
* [, 5]	drat	Rear axle ratio
* [, 6]	wt	Weight (1000 lbs)
* [, 7]	qsec	1/4 mile time
* [, 8]	vs	Engine (0 = V-shaped, 1 = straight)
* [, 9]	am	Transmission (0 = automatic, 1 = manual)
* [,10]	gear	Number of forward gears
* [,11]	carb	Number of carburetors

## Code documentation

* `green_pal <- function(x) rgb(colorRamp(c("#829F7A", "#1A9625"))(x), maxColorValue = 255)`
These functions return functions that interpolate a set of given colors to create new color palettes

* Sort the HP column in order, and place the highest value in dark green

  `list(hp = "desc"), columns = list(hp = colDef(style = function(value) ` 
  `{normalized <- (value - min(data$hp)) / (max(data$hp) - min(data$hp)) color <- green_pal(normalized) list(background = color)` 
  
* Make dataset columns filterable `reactable(data, filterable = TRUE)`

* Broup By  
  am Transmission (0 = automatic, 1 = manual)

 `reactable(data, groupBy = c("am"))`
 
* Show pagination  `reactable(data, showPagination = TRUE)`

* Highlight rows on hover `reactable(data, highlight = TRUE)`

## Example table


```{r t,echo=TRUE}

#install.packages("reactable") 
library(reactable)
data <- mtcars[1:11, ]
green_pal <- function(x) rgb(colorRamp(c("#829F7A", "#1A9625"))(x), maxColorValue = 255)


reactable(data,groupBy = c("am"), filterable = TRUE,showPagination = TRUE,highlight = TRUE,defaultSorted = list(hp = "desc"), columns = list(
  hp = colDef(style = function(value) {
    normalized <- (value - min(data$hp)) / (max(data$hp) - min(data$hp))
    color <- green_pal(normalized)
    list(background = color)
  })
))
 
```
